sen.j: 平 惟範（たいら の これのり、斉衡2年（855年） - 延喜9年9月18日 (旧暦)（909年11月3日））は、平安時代前期の貴族。
sen.e: TAIRA no Korenori (855 - November 3, 909) was a nobility in the early Heian period.
TAIRA no Korenori (855 - November 3, 909) was a noble in the early Heian period.
TAIRA no Korenori (855 - November 3, 909) was a noble in the early Heian period.

sen.j: 平高棟（高棟王）の3男で、桓武天皇の曾孫にあたる。
sen.e: He was the third son of TAIRA no Takamune (Prince Takamune) and a great-grandson of Emperor Kanmu.
He was the third son of TAIRA no Takamune (Prince Takamune) and a great-grandson of Emperor Kanmu.
He was the third son of TAIRA no Takamune (Prince Takamune) and a great-grandson of Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: 母は、贈太政大臣藤原長良の娘で従四位上典侍従藤原有子。
sen.e: His mother was FUJIWARA no Ariko who held the rank of Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and the title of jiju (a chamberlain), the daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara, who held the title of zo daijo daijin (the Grand Minister, posthumously conferred).

His mother was FUJIWARA no Ariko, who held the rank of Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and the title of jiju (a chamberlain) and was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara, who held the title of zo daijo daijin (the Grand Minister, posthumously conferred).
sen.cmt: edited to make it a bit clearer
sen.e: His mother was FUJIWARA no Ariko, who held the rank of Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and the title of jiju (a chamberlain) and was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara, who held the title of zo daijo daijin (the Grand Minister, posthumously conferred).

sen.j: 妻は人康親王の娘。
sen.e: His wife was the daughter of Imperial Prince Saneyasu.
His wife was the daughter of Imperial Prince Saneyasu.
His wife was the daughter of Imperial Prince Saneyasu.

sen.j: 子に平時望、平伊望がいる。
sen.e: His children included TAIRA no Tokimochi and TAIRA no Koremochi.
His children included TAIRA no Tokimochi and TAIRA no Koremochi.
His children included TAIRA no Tokimochi and TAIRA no Koremochi.

sen.j: 貞観 (日本)16年（874年）1月23日、従五位下に叙位。
sen.e: February 18, 874: He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
February 18, 874: He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
February 18, 874: He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 12月6日、蔵人に補す。
sen.e: January 20, 875: He was appointed as Kurodo (Chamberlain).
January 20, 875: He was appointed to Kurodo (Chamberlain).
January 20, 875: He was appointed to Kurodo (Chamberlain).

sen.j: 貞観17年（875年）8月15日、皇太后宮（摂政藤原良房娘・藤原明子 (染殿后)）亮に遷任。
sen.e: September 22, 875: He was appointed as Kotaigogu no suke (assistant master of the empress dowager's household) (FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko (Some dono no kisaki), the daughter of FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, who held the title of Sessho (regent)).

September 22, 875: He was appointed to assistant master of the empress dowager's household (FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko - Some dono no kisaki - the daughter of FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, who held the title of Sessho/regent).
sen.cmt: cleaned up the parentheses a little
sen.e: September 22, 875: He was appointed to assistant master of the empress dowager's household (FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko - Some dono no kisaki - the daughter of FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, who held the title of Sessho/regent).

sen.j: 元慶元年（877年）11月21日、従五位上に昇叙。
sen.e: January 2, 878: He rose to the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
January 2, 878: He rose to the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
January 2, 878: He rose to the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 皇太后宮亮如元。
sen.e: Retained his position as Kotaigogu no suke.
Retained his position as Kotaigogu no suke.
Retained his position as Kotaigogu no suke.

sen.j: 元慶3年（879年）2月15日、備後国を兼任。
sen.e: March 15, 879: He was appointed to work in Bingo Province.
March 15, 879: He was appointed to work in Bingo Province.
March 15, 879: He was appointed to work in Bingo Province.

sen.j: 元慶4年（880年）1月11日、備前国を兼任。
sen.e: February 28, 880: He was appointed to work in Bingo Province.
February 28, 880: He was appointed to work in Bingo Province.
February 28, 880: He was appointed to work in Bizen Province.
sen.cmt: スペース削除地名修正

sen.j: 備後権介を去る。
sen.e: Resigned as Bingo gon no suke (provisional assistant governor of Bingo Province).
Resigned as Bingo gon no suke (provisional assistant governor of Bingo Province).
Resigned as Bingo gon no suke (provisional assistant governor of Bingo Province).

sen.j: 4月15日、正五位下に昇叙。
sen.e: May 31: He rose to the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
May 31: He rose to the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
May 31: He rose to the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 皇太后宮亮・備前権介如元。
sen.e: Retained his positions as Kotaigogu no suke and Bingo gon no suke.
Retained his positions as Kotaigogu no suke and Bingo gon no suke.
Retained his positions as Kotaigogu no suke and Bizen gon no suke.

sen.j: 元慶6年（882年）1月7日、皇太后宮藤原明子が太皇太后へ異動に伴い、皇太后宮は、皇太夫人藤原高子（贈太政大臣藤原長良娘）となる。
sen.e: February 2, 882: As the empress dowager FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko became the grand empress dowager, the previous retired emperors' wife FUJIWARA no Takaiko (the daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara who held the title of zo daijo daijin) became an empress dowager.

February 2, 882: As the empress dowager FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko became the grand empress dowager, the previous retired emperors' wife FUJIWARA no Takaiko (the daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara who held the title of zo daijo daijin) became an empress dowager.

February 2, 882: As the empress dowager FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko became the grand empress dowager, the previous retired emperors' wife FUJIWARA no Takaiko (the daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara who held the title of zo daijo daijin) became an empress dowager.

sen.j: 仁和2年（886年）1月7日、従四位下に昇叙。
sen.e: February 18, 886: He rose to the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade).
February 18, 886: He rose to the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
February 18, 886: He rose to the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 皇太后宮亮・備前権介如元。
sen.e: Retained his positions as Kotaigogu no suke and Bingo gon no suke.
Retained his positions as Kotaigogu no suke and Bingo gon no suke.
Retained his positions as Kotaigogu no suke and Bizen gon no suke.

sen.j: 仁和3年（887年）2月17日、民部省を兼任。
sen.e: March 19, 887: He served concurrently as Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).
March 19, 887: He served concurrently at Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).
March 19, 887: He served concurrently at Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 5月13日、弾正台を兼任。
sen.e: June 12: He served concurrently as danjodai (Board of Censors).
June 12: He served concurrently on danjodai (Board of Censors).
June 12: He served concurrently on danjodai (Board of Censors).

sen.j: 民部大輔を去る。
sen.e: Left the office of Minbu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).
Left the office of Minbu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).
Left the office of Minbu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 寛平2年（890年）1月18日、式部省を兼任。
sen.e: February 15, 890: He served concurrently as Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial).
February 15, 890: He served concurrently in Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial).
February 15, 890: He served concurrently in Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 寛平5年（893年）3月15日、肥後国を兼任。
sen.e: April 9, 893: He was appointed to work in Higo Province.
April 9, 893: He was appointed to work in Higo Province.
April 9, 893: He was appointed to work in Higo Province.

sen.j: 寛平6年（894年）1月７日、従四位上に昇叙。
sen.e: February 20, 894: He rose to the rank of Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
February 20, 894: He rose to the rank of Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
February 20, 894: He rose to the rank of Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 皇太后宮亮・式部大輔・弾正大弼・肥後権守如元。
sen.e: Retained his positions as Kotaigogu no suke, Shikibu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial), danjo-daihitsu (senior assistant President of the Board of Censors), and Higo no Gon no kami (Provisional Governor of Higo Province).

Retained his positions as Kotaigogu no suke, Shikibu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial), danjo-daihitsu (senior assistant President of the Board of Censors), and Higo no Gon no kami (Provisional Governor of Higo Province).

sen.j: 寛平9年（897年）5月25日、大蔵省に転任。
sen.e: July 2, 897: He was transferred to the Ministry of Finance.
July 2, 897: He was transferred to the Ministry of Finance.
July 2, 897: He was transferred to the Ministry of Finance.

sen.j: 6月19日、太皇太后宮（前掲藤原明子）権大夫を兼任。
sen.e: July 26: He served concurrently as Taikotaigogu gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Grand Empress Dowager's Household) (FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko).
July 26: He served concurrently as Taikotaigogu gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Household of Grand Empress Dowager, the aforementioned FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko).
July 26: He served concurrently as Taikotaigogu gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Household of Grand Empress Dowager, the aforementioned FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko).

sen.j: 延喜2年（902年）1月26日、参議に補任。
sen.e: March 13, 902: He served concurrently as Sangi (councillor).
March 13, 902: He served concurrently as Sangi (councillor).
March 13, 902: He served concurrently as Sangi (councillor).

sen.j: 大蔵卿兼任如元。
sen.e: Retained his positions as Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury).
Retained his positions as Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury).
Retained his positions as Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury).

sen.j: 延喜3年（903年）2月16日、播磨国を兼任。
sen.e: March 22, 903: He was appointed to work in Harima Province.
March 22, 903: He was appointed to work in Harima Province.
March 22, 903: He was appointed to work in Harima Province.

sen.j: 延喜4年（904年）1月７日、正四位下に昇叙。
sen.e: February 1, 904: He rose to the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
February 1, 904: He rose to the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 参議・大蔵卿・播磨権守如元。
sen.e: Retained his positions as Sangi, Okura-kyo, and Harima no Gon no kami (Provisional Governor of Harima Province).
Retained his positions as Sangi, Okura-kyo, and Harima no Gon no kami (Provisional Governor of Harima Province).
Retained his positions as Sangi, Okura-kyo, and Harima no Gon no kami (Provisional Governor of Harima Province).

sen.j: 延喜6年（906年）1月11日、播磨国を兼任（重任扱い）
sen.e: February 12, 906: He was reappointed to work in Harima Province.
February 12, 906: He was reappointed to work in Harima Province.
February 12, 906: He was reappointed to work in Harima Province.

sen.j: 延喜7年（907年）1月13日、衛門府を兼任。
sen.e: March 4, 907: He served concurrently as Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards).
March 4, 907: He served concurrently as Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards).
March 4, 907: He served concurrently as Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards).

sen.j: 大蔵卿・播磨権守を去る。
sen.e: Resigned as Okura-kyo and Harima no Gon no kami.
Resigned as Okura-kyo and Harima no Gon no kami.
Resigned as Okura-kyo and Harima no Gon no kami.

sen.j: 延喜8年（908年）1月16日、従三位に昇叙。
sen.e: February 25, 908: He rose to the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
February 25, 908: He rose to the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
February 25, 908: He rose to the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: 中納言に転任。
sen.e: He was transferred to the office of Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
He was transferred to the office of Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: 衛門府を兼任。
sen.e: He served concurrently as Emonfu.
He served concurrently as Emonfu.
He served concurrently as Emonfu.

sen.j: 3月5日、検非違使別当を兼ぬ。
sen.e: April 13: He served concurrently as Kebiishi no betto (Superintendent of the Imperial Police).
April 13: He served concurrently as Kebiishi no betto (Superintendent of the Imperial Police).
April 13: He served concurrently as Kebiishi no betto (Superintendent of the Imperial Police).

sen.j: 8月26日（または同月28日）、民部省を兼任。
sen.e: September 29 (or October 1): He served concurrently as Minbusho.
sen.cmt: 西暦908年9月29日(または西暦908年10月1日）
sen.e: September 29 (or October 1): He served concurrently as Minbusho.

sen.j: 検非違使別当・左兵衛督を去る。
sen.e: Resigned as Kebiishi no betto and Sahyoe no kami (Captain of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).

sen.j: 延喜9年（909年）4月22日、近衛府を兼任。
sen.e: May 19, 909: He served concurrently as Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 民部卿を去る。
sen.e: He resigned as Minbukyo (Minister of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 9月18日、薨去。
sen.e: November 8: He died.

sen.j: 享年55。
